intro: Spermacoce setosa, commonly known as the silky spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant has slender, hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly serrated edge. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Spermacoce setosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
